item.title: Colorectal Cancer and African Americans: Don’t be Afraid to Live
item.dc:creator: rdyer
item.excerpt:encoded: Dr. Fritz Francois of New York University’s Langone Medical Center explains the special concerns for African Americans when it comes to colorectal cancer—including higher incidence and mortality rates, underutilization of screening, and why the American College of Gastroenterology recommends that African Americans begin screening at 45.

item.title: Fertility and Reproduction
item.dc:creator: rdyer
item.excerpt:encoded: With an emphasis on helping patients live well despite their IBD, these podcasts address issues surrounding reproduction and fertility; diet and nutrition; new and emerging therapies; the importance of clinical trials; and pediatric IBD.
